title: Gang storms school with knives and axe | 7NEWS
description: Six teenagers have been charged over a stabbing attack at Ellenbrook Secondary College, where a gang armed with knives and an axe stormed the school targeting a 15-year-old student. The attack was allegedly motivated by revenge over online abuse, with a south-side gang travelling north of the river to carry out the assault. The victim was hospitalised with wounds to his arm and head, while two of the accused teens remain in custody and the youngest offender is just 13 years old. title: Perth council in chaos over CEO removal plot | 7NEWS
description: The City of Perth is experiencing severe internal turmoil with CEO Michelle Reynolds claiming the Lord Mayor has engineered a plot to remove her through a $125,000 cultural review. The deputy CEO has requested urgent state government intervention while residents' concerns about basic safety issues like lighting in parks are being overshadowed by the council dysfunction. title: Search for mother and son following axe attack on man | 7NEWS
description: Police are searching for 41-year-old Carl Allen and his 63-year-old mother Denise Kathleen Allen after an axe attack on 82-year-old great-grandfather Albert Bullock at Caversham Caravan Park. The pair disappeared last Thursday and may be travelling together in a black Ford Ranger Raptor ute, with police expressing concern for the mother's welfare. title: Australia's social media ban for kids begins as 22 people have been killed in an office fire | 7NEWS
description: Australia implements a world-first social media ban for children under 16, blocking access to platforms like Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat as part of the government's plan to combat online bullying and negative effects of big tech. The ban took effect at midnight, marking the first time Australian children have woken up without access to these social media platforms. title: Australia's under-16 social media ban begins
description: Millions of teenagers are now banned from social media as world-first laws aimed at better protecting children online come into force. Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, YouTube and TikTok are among the platforms which have agreed to enforce the rules, barring anyone under 16 from holding an account. #socialmediaban #socialmedia #ban #auspol #albanese

title: Children's toy recalled over asbestos fears
description: Kmart has pulled three toy sets from its shelves after it was discovered they contained sand that may be contaminated with asbestos. #asbestos #recall #productrecall #bluey #toy

title: At least 22 people killed in Jakarta office fire
description: A fire has broken out in a seven-storey building in Indonesia's capital Jakarta, killing at least 22 people. #jakarta #fire #officefire #inferno #blaze

title: New bodycam of Luigi Mangione's arrest at McDonald's with fake ID | 7NEWS
description: Luigi Mangione was arrested at a Pennsylvania McDonald's after a restaurant manager called 911 when customers recognised him as the suspected CEO shooter. Police body camera footage shows his arrest using a fake ID under the name Mark Rosario, with his distinctive eyebrows giving him away despite wearing a beanie and mask. His lawyers are arguing that evidence found in his backpack, including a gun, silencer, manifesto, and handwritten notes, should be excluded from his trial for the murder of healthcare executive Brian Thompson because police lacked a search warrant. description: A one-year-old girl has died after being hit by a ute at Port Stephens, north of Newcastle. #toddler #ute #portstephens #newcastle #nsw

title: Man shot and stabbed in Sydney's southwest
description: A man has presented himself to Bankstown Hospital after he was shot and stabbed in Sydney's southwest. #bankstown #bankstownhospital #sydney #sydneycrime #nswpolice

title: Lady Gaga fans battle huge queues for Brisbane show
description: Lady Gaga fans are furious after missing the start of her concert at Suncorp Stadium due to a technical problem. Gates opened 30 minutes behind schedule, with some fans saying they waited more than two-and-a-half hours in line to see the show. #LadyGaga #Queue #Concert #SuncorpStadium #Brisbane
